      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Parameters:
        args - -TEST List the separated TEST data.
        args - -USERS List the separated USERS data.
        args - -MOVIES List the separated MOVIES data.
        args - -RATINGS List the separated RATINGS data.
        args - -details Print out the amount of element in this project.
        args - -help Print out the help information.
        args - -reload Reload the cache, if the program behaves inappropriate try use this argument to fix.

      • summarizeOccupation

        public static java.lang.String[][] summarizeOccupation(java.lang.String[][] userInfo,
                                                       int columnOfOccupation,
                                                       boolean decreaseOrder)
        Summarize the occupation information.
        Parameters:
        userInfo - The array which consists occupation information.
        columnOfOccupation - The column contain the name of occupation
        decreaseOrder - Set "true" as order amount of people in decreasing. Otherwise use default order.
        Returns:
        A string array consists with the name of occupation and the amount of people undergoing with it.

        Parameters:

      • summarizeGender

        public static int[] summarizeGender(java.lang.String[][] userInfo,
                                    int columnOfGender)
        Summarize the amount of user in two genders.
        Parameters:
        userInfo - The separated user String array.
        columnOfGender - The column of gender info.
        Returns:
        The integer array consist of 2 genders, while [0] is male [1] is female.

      • summarizeAge

        public static int[][] summarizeAge(java.lang.String[][] userInfo,
                                   int columnOfAge,
                                   int columnOfGender)
        Summarize the age distribution with gender. Age Sum Male Female 0~17 * * * 18~35 * * * 36~50 * * * 51~70 * * * 70~100 * * * *indicates the data area
        Parameters:
        userInfo - User information string
        columnOfAge - Column indicates age
        columnOfGender - Column indicates gender
        Returns:
        A 5*3 integer array consists age distribution and sum of people in 2 genders.

      • getGenderRatio

        public static java.lang.String[][] getGenderRatio(int[][] summarizedGenderWithAge)
        Get the ratio of two genders in one group of people. Use this method with summarizeAge(String[][] userInfo, int columnOfAge, int columnOfGender) Age Male Female 0~17 * * 18~35 * * 36~50 * * 51~70 * * 70~100 * *
        Parameters:
        summarizedGenderWithAge - The output from summarizeAge(String[][] userInfo, int columnOfAge, int columnOfGender)
        Returns:
        A 5*2 String array consists the ratio of 2 genders.

      • toSignificantFiguresString

        public static java.lang.String toSignificantFiguresString(java.math.BigDecimal bd,
                                                          int significantFigures)
        Get a string of significant figured big decimal.
        Parameters:
        bd - Big decimal. Also could use BigDEcimal.valueOf(double) to evaluate double type.
        significantFigures - The amount of significant digit.
        Returns:
        The string of rounded value.

      • getAgeRatio

        public static java.lang.String[] getAgeRatio(int[][] summarizedAge,
                                             int userAmount)
        Get the age ratio from one section to all.
        Parameters:
        summarizedAge - The output from summarizeAge(String[][] userInfo, int columnOfAge, int columnOfGender)
        userAmount - The amount of users
        Returns:
        The string consists the percentage regarding to age distribution.

      • getOverallGenderRatio

        public static java.lang.String[] getOverallGenderRatio(int[] summarizedGender,
                                                       int userAmount)
        Get overall gender ratio.
        Parameters:
        summarizedGender - The output from summarizeGender(String[][] userInfo, int columnOfGender)
        userAmount - The amount of users
        Returns:
        The overall gender ratio. [0] is male, [1] is female.

      • getPearsonCoefficient

        public static double[][] getPearsonCoefficient(double[] x_rate,
                                               double[] y_rate,
                                               double x_mean,
                                               double y_mean)
        Find the Pearson coefficient array by the rating of x (x_rate) and rating of y (y_rate), and x, y are 2 persons.
        Parameters:
        x_rate - The rating of x to a movie.
        y_rate - The rating of y to a movie.
        x_mean - The overall average of x's rating.
        y_mean - The overall average of y's rating.
        Returns:
        The Pearson coefficient, r[x][y].

      • getRatingsByUserID

        public static java.lang.String[][] getRatingsByUserID(int UserID,
                                                      java.lang.String[][] separatedRatings)
        Get the ratings by one user by ID. !Be advised! The last row includes the mean value! Do not count last value!
        Parameters:
        UserID - The ID of certain user.
        separatedRatings - The separated ratings array. In this case it is 'separated_RATINGS'.
        Returns:
        A 2D string array consist by MovieID and ratings. The last row column 2 is the average value.

      • merge2DString

        Merge 2D String array into String array with a unique split keyword.
        Parameters:
        originalString - The original 2D String array.
        splitKeyword - The unique keyword.
        Returns:
        Merged String array.
